skillTree.localised_description: Named for one of Lokhir's ancestors, this favoured Sea Dragon belches ocean brine in place of fire as it carries the Krakenlord to battle.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

skillTree.localised_description: There is great pleasure to be derived from the humiliation and suffering of others; this one has felt and revelled in it.
The strength of this warrior's attack never wavers for an instance, such is the opprobrium felt for their hated High Elf cousins.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against High Elves

skillTree.localised_description: The Bloody-handed God watches over his disciples.
Magic's dark mistress has a care for her dutiful acolytes.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +20% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Murder in the frontline, bang your head against the deck. The metal takes its priceâ€¦"
The Krakenlord comes from a very long line of raiders, admirals and map-makers; a chip off the old block, you might say!

skillTree.localised_description: The best sailors know their charts back to front and are always leagues ahead of the tide.

skillTree.localised_description: Showing his hand from the off, that there might be no confusion amongst his crews, Fellheart had his father's officers sacrificed to Mathlann.

effects.description: Army ability number of uses: +1 for all Black Ark bombardment abilities

ui_effects.localised_text: A single bolt of magical lightning
A small cluster of magical souls
A huge cluster of magical souls
A large cluster of magical souls

skillTree.localised_description: Those unfortunates captured during a scrap will serve the Dreadfleet one way or another.
Never was a name so perfectly descriptive, and this one is their leader!

effects.description: Slave Cost: -75% for Sacrifice to Anath Raema and Sacrifice to Mathlann

Melee attack: +8 when fighting at sea
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Follow me, and we will take from the weak anything we desire.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -25% for Black Ark Corsairs units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The deeds and tales of the worldâ€™s most notorious admiral are not exaggerated. The Tower of Blessed Dreadâ€™s coffers overflow.
Loyalty is usually bought in Naggaroth. Lokhir has earned the loyalty of his corsairs by leading them directly in battle. And, of course, rewarding them well afterwards.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% for Dreadspears, Darkshards, Bleakswords and Black Ark Corsairs units
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: You want riches? Gold? Slaves? Fame? The favor of Mathlann? I will provide you with all, and more.
He is loyal. And of course, it serves him well to see us return safely to ship, with his cut of the plunder.

effects.description:
Enemy charge bonus: -50%
	(enemy armies in province)

skillTree.localised_description: The tough, scaly hide of the Sea Dragon provides excellent protection against all manner of blows.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

attributes.bullet_text: When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Magic is a most useful tool on the field of battle, but generally secondary in the face of good, old-fashioned brute force.

skillTree.localised_description: An elite even amongst elites, this accomplished warrior directs the cut-and-thrust of melee - a choreographer of death, you might say.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
This one ensures that those captured in battle wished they'd died on the field, so great is the cruelty that awaits them.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
If there were annals detailing the dastardly deeds of the sackers and looters of the world, this inveterate brigand would feature heavily.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Knowing precisely where and when to launch an ambush, and against who, takes an unusual level of guile.

skillTree.localised_description: The ancient Asur arts teach one how to heal as well as how to harm.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

factionEffects.localised_description: Lokhir ensures Mathlann's favour by stealing, killing, and sacrificing in his name. Those who see Lokhir's famous Black Ark, the Tower of Blessed Dread, should prepare either for death or for servitude - the only fates possible for any of Lokhir's targets.

ui_effects.localised_text: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

effects.description: Sacrifice to Anath Raema: Improves Corsairs and Kharibdyss units
Every owned Major Port will allow the recruitment of a Black Ark and unlock unique technologies
Unique units: Sea Dragons and Creeping Dread (increasing capacity per Black Ark)

items.colour_text: These blades gain their red hue from both the Indan Bloodsteel from which they are forged and the viscera which so often covers them.
